definition: (of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
surname Rong
glory/honor/thriving
disgrace/dishonor/to insult/to bring disgrace or humiliation to/to be indebted to/self-deprecating/Taiwan pr. [ru4]
to take part in
and/to give/together with
variant of 歟|欤[yu2]
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party

sentences.english: What Americans do at times of tragedy is to come together and support each other.
sentences.chinese: 风雨同舟，荣辱与共是美国人民面对不幸的传统美德。

sentences.english: Beijing has clearly thrown in its lot with the Kim dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 北京方面显然已决定与金氏王朝荣辱与共。

sentences.english: Encourage your associates to hold a stake in the company.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励你的同事们与公司荣辱与共，休戚相关。

sentences.english: We are part of China. Our futures are forever linked.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国一部分，血脉相连，荣辱与共。

sentences.english: In this country, we share weal and woe .
sentences.chinese: 在这个国家，我们荣辱与共。

sentences.english: A belief that we are connected as one people.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们作为一个民族荣辱与共的信仰。

sentences.english: She shares my troubles as well as my joys.

definition: cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
to share joys and sorrows/sharing good times and hard times/same as 同甘共苦
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
to stick together through thick and thin (idiom)
of one mind (idiom)
hand in hand and shoulder to shoulder
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
To enjoy blessings and endure misfortune together (idiom); for better or for worse
pinyin: you3 fu2 tong2 xiang3 , you3 nan4 tong2 dang1

definition: to share the same interests (idiom)/to be closely related/to be in the same boat
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
to be of one mind/to think or act alike
family-like close relationship (idiom)
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
